intro: Picris strigosa subsp. turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkestan fumitory, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
